justification: Migraines can cause a variety of neurological symptoms, including numbness, parasthesia, scotoma (visual disturbances), headache, and dysarthria (difficulty speaking). The presence of aura, particularly visual aura, strongly suggests migraine.}, {diagnosis: Transient ischemic attack (TIA)

justification: TIAs are caused by a temporary interruption of blood flow to the brain and can cause a range of neurological symptoms, including numbness, parasthesia, visual disturbances, and dysarthria. Headaches are less common but can occur.}, {diagnosis: Multiple sclerosis (MS)

justification: MS is an autoimmune disease that affects the central nervous system and can cause a wide variety of neurological symptoms, including numbness, parasthesia, visual disturbances, headache, and dysarthria.}, {diagnosis: Stroke

justification: Strokes occur when blood flow to the brain is interrupted, leading to neurological symptoms that depend on the area of the brain affected. Numbness, parasthesia, visual disturbances, headache, and dysarthria are all possible stroke symptoms.}, {diagnosis: Brain tumor

justification: Brain tumors can cause a variety of neurological symptoms depending on their size and location, including numbness, parasthesia, visual disturbances, headache, and dysarthria.}, {diagnosis: Epilepsy

justification: Certain types of seizures, particularly focal seizures, can cause temporary neurological symptoms such as numbness, parasthesia, visual disturbances, and dysarthria. Headaches can also occur after a seizure.}, {diagnosis: Bells palsy

justification: Bells palsy is a condition that causes temporary weakness or paralysis of the facial muscles, which can lead to numbness or parasthesia on one side of the face. While headache is not typical, it can occur in some cases.}, {diagnosis: Hypoglycemia

justification: Low blood sugar can cause a range of symptoms, including headache, numbness, and tingling. In severe cases, it can also lead to confusion, slurred speech (dysarthria), and visual disturbances.}, {diagnosis: Panic attack

justification: Panic attacks are characterized by intense fear and anxiety, which can trigger physical symptoms such as headache, numbness, tingling, dizziness, and difficulty speaking.}, {diagnosis: Medication side effects

justification: Certain medications can cause neurological side effects such as numbness, parasthesia, headache, visual disturbances, and dysarthria. Its important to consider any medications the individual is taking.}
